About me

Hello, I’m Rhys.

I struggle to say what I am these days, but I’ve been an administrator for a website, an editor, dabbled in UX, a front-end developer, a web performance specialist, worked on a data and analytics platform, written lots of developer tooling, and now find myself working in my employer’s version of a Site Reliabilty Engineering team. My employer’s the FT, by the way.

I like to think I’ve carried over a lot of experience and knowledge from my previous incarnations along with me, and now do a passable job of tackling any tech problem that’s put in front of me and the teams I lead.

I would do anything for love, but I won’t transpile.

I would love it if you donated some money to Refugee Support, a charity very close to my heart.

The dots and swirls in the background are inspired by this video from numberphile.
